text: A close up quartering view of Grey Lady at dock MV Grey Lady is a high speed catamaran ferry operated by Hy-Line Cruises that travels on a route between Hyannis and Nantucket. The vessel was designed by Incat Crowther and ordered from Gladding-Hearn Shipbuilding in February 2002. While she was originally to be named Grey Lady III, following two previous ferries of that name, when she was delivered in May 2003 she bore the name Grey Lady. Grey Lady is long, with a beam of and a draft of . She has four Cummins diesel engines that can propel her at up to , though her normal service speed is . She has a passenger capacity of 300. ==References== Category:Ferries of Massachusetts Category:2003 ships Category:Ships built in Somerset, Massachusetts
title: MV Grey Lady
